answers.answer: read your entry here, you seem to of put yourself in a no win situation, get some outside professional advise, open your mind to options. be good and keep us posted.

omg!  If you had diabetes...wouldn't you go to the Dr. to get help?  When your car is broken...don't you go and get it fixed?  YOU ARE WORTH MORE THAN A CAR!  Go and see your Doctor.  I felt the same way 6 years ago...then went and got on some good medication, had some counseling...and 6 years later...and very happy w/ occasional panic attacks a couple times a year.  YOU ARE WORTH IT!  There is nothing to be ashamed of...start talking to people, and you'd find out that SO many people can relate.

question: Hello,I have been in a state of literally constant worry/panic for nearly a year now.  I have always been a hypochondriac.  In 10th grade I got 2 MRI's because I was convinced I had a tumor.  A year ago I had an ill advised sexual encounter and as a result was convinced for 7 months that I had caught an STD despite 5 rounds of negative testing.  I know now that I did not and I am fine, but the feeling of extreme anxiety is still there, round the clock, and when something that SHOULD induce anxiety comes along I have a panic attack because my background anxiety level is so high to begin with that the added anxiety overloads my system.  Ironically, I am now worried that I have developed some kind of heart problem as I have heard that extreme stress can mess up your heart.  My left arm feels constricted, I have chest pressure, etc.  I would probably find the irony in this mildly amusing if I could find anything amusing at all.  I haven't truly enjoyed anything in almost a year and this anxiety is heavily affecting my grades.Through all this I have somehow managed to develop a relationship with a girl that I really like, and who for some inexplicable reason likes me.  Instead of helping with my stress level, this relationship adds to it.  I am constantly worried that this problem will hurt our relationship, and I am reluctant to get intimate for fear that those STD tests were wrong and that I might give her an STD which would probably send me into an abyss of depression and anxiety that I don't think I could recover from.  I realize that all of this is irrational and unfounded, but that does not make a difference.What the hell am I supposed to do?  I am reluctant to see a doctor because one of my friends was prescribed benzos and became an addict.  I don't want to end up like him, but if I don't do something about this its going to start hurting my relationships with other people... I have been able to hide my problem from others for a long time but I can't keep this up much longer.  I feel like my chest will explode.Any advice?
title: Extreme constant anxiety/panic attacks
